title: Relative motion - two cars in motion

content.question: The position-time graph represents the motion of two cars, Car <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math> and Car <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>T</mtext></math>, moving in the same, straight path. At which of the indicated times, <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="t sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="t sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math>, would Car <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math> first appear to be moving in the negative direction as observed by a passenger in Car <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>T</mtext></math>?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
